unnormalised: Ferry services between Mumbai and Goa are set to pre-pone their regular schedules to accommodate the Diwali rush. The Maharashtra Maritime Board (MMB) has announced additional trips starting 20/10/2024. The increased frequency aims to alleviate pressure on roadways and railways during the festive season.
normalised: Ferry services between Mumbai and Goa are set to pre-pone their regular schedules to accommodate the Diwali rush. The Maharashtra Maritime Board (M-M-B) has announced additional trips starting twentieth october two thousand and twenty four. The increased frequency aims to alleviate pressure on roadways and railways during the festive season.

unnormalised: The ferry route covers approximately 400 km and takes around 12 hrs, offering a scenic alternative to road or rail travel. Tickets range from Rs. 3,000 to Rs. 7,000 depending on the class and time of booking. Passengers can book tickets online at the MMB website or through authorized travel agents.
normalised: The ferry route covers approximately four hundred kilometer and takes around twelve hours, offering a scenic alternative to road or rail travel. Tickets range from rupee three thousand to rupee seven thousand depending on the class and time of booking. Passengers can book tickets online at the M-M-B website or through authorized travel agents.

unnormalised: MMB Chairman, IAS officer Mr. Sanjay Gupta, stated that safety measures have been increased for the festive season. He also mentioned plans to introduce new ferry routes connecting other coastal cities in Maharashtra by Q1 2025, further boosting coastal tourism and providing alternate transportation options.
normalised: M-M-B Chairman, I-A-S officer Mister Sanjay Gupta, stated that safety measures have been increased for the festive season. He also mentioned plans to introduce new ferry routes connecting other coastal cities in Maharashtra by Q one two thousand and twenty five, further boosting coastal tourism and providing alternate transportation options.
